title: Killing C.I.A. Informants, China Crippled U.S. Spying Operations
media.description: An honor guard outside the Great Hall of the People in Beijing last month. The Chinese government killed or imprisoned 18 to 20 C.I.A sources from 2010 through 2012.

title: Trump Rules: How Rollbacks at Scott Pruitt’s E.P.A. Are a Boon to Oil and Gas
media.description: Devon Energy’s Beaver Creek gas plant outside Riverton, Wyo. The company was prepared to install sophisticated equipment to reduce emissions of hazardous air pollution. Since Scott Pruitt assumed the helm of the Environmental Protection Agency, the company has pulled back from its proposals.

title: ‘Vulnerable Voices’ Lash Out as Companies Sway Climate Talks
media.description: Workers from Wuhan Guangsheng Photovoltaic installed solar panels on the roof of a building in Wuhan, China, last month. China has become a defender of an ambitious climate change policy.

title: As Their Clout Wanes, Saudi Arabia and Russia Extend Oil Production Cuts
media.description: The Manifa oil field in Saudi Arabia.

title: Tillerson, in Alaska, Gives No Hint on Paris Climate Accord
media.description: Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson, center, met on Thursday with foreign ministers from other nations with Arctic territory.

title: Matter: To Simulate Climate Change, Scientists Build Miniature Worlds
media.description: A researcher ran tests on a miniature ecosystem of sand, sea grass, algae, invertebrates and fish that was designed to simulate the impact of climate change.

title: Stay In or Leave the Paris Climate Deal? Lessons From Kyoto
media.description: Documents used by President Barack Obama and President Xi Jinping of China to announce their countries’ formal adoption of the Paris agreement at a ceremony in 2016.
description: The Paris accord provides its members with more flexibility than the earlier Kyoto Protocol, an argument for those who want the United States to remain in the deal.

title: Obama Sees New Front in Climate Change Battle: Agriculture
media.description: Former President Barack Obama talked with Sam Kass about the effect of agriculture on climate change at the Seeds & Chips conference on Tuesday in Milan.

title: Arctic Nations to Meet Amid Unsettled U.S. Stance on Climate Change
media.description: A cargo ship in an inlet of the Barents Sea close to the Russian port of Murmansk, in January. Russia has announced it will begin shipping natural gas from an Arctic port this fall using special icebreaking tankers.
description: With the Trump administration still undecided about the Paris climate accord, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson is to head to a meeting of the Arctic Council in Alaska.

title: Tundra May Be Shifting Alaska to Put Out More Carbon Than It Stores, Study Says
media.description: The tundra about 35 miles north of Nome, Alaska. A new study suggests that the state, with its huge stretches of tundra and forest, may be shifting from a net sink, or storehouse, of carbon to a net source.

title: E.P.A. Dismisses Members of Major Scientific Review Board
media.description: Scott Pruitt, left, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, with President Trump and a group of coal miners in March as the president signed an executive order that rolled back many climate-change policies.
description: A spokesman for the agency’s administrator said he would consider replacing the academic scientists with representatives from industries the agency is supposed to regulate.

title: The Health Issue: The Mystery of the Wasting House-Cats
media.description: #NA

description: Forty years ago, feline hyperthyroidism was virtually nonexistent. Now it’s an epidemic — and some scientists think a class of everyday chemicals might be to blame.

title: The Health Issue: The Genetics of Pooched-Out Pooches
media.description: #NA
media.credit: Photo illustration by Catherine Ledner for the New York Times. Prop stylist: Jeanne Kelley.

title: Entrepreneurship: Travel Agents for Youth Sports Teams? Not All See It as a Perk

title: The President Changed. So Has Small Businesses’ Confidence.

title: Entrepreneurship: How Small Firms Can Defuse a Political Threat and Blunt a Boycott

When Ms. Morgenthau received an email from a Trump supporter threatening a boycott of her store, she posted the letter and her reply on Facebook, leading to an outpouring of support and an increase in business.

dc.creator: PATRICIA COHEN

title: Your Money Adviser: Simple Rule for Calculating Where You Stand on College Savings
media.description: #NA
description: Multiplying your child’s age by $2,000 will give you an idea of how much you should have saved by that point, though there are other factors to consider.
dc.creator: ANN CARRNS

title: Wealth Matters: Bringing Family Wealth to Bear Against a Relentless Illness
media.description: David Dolby at the St. Francis Yacht Club in San Francisco. The club was significant to his father, Ray Dolby, especially toward the end of his life.
media.credit: Christie Hemm Klok for The New York Times
description: Family offices, which manage money for rich clans, sometimes throw their considerable weight behind efforts to tackle an illness afflicting one or more relatives.
dc.creator: PAUL SULLIVAN

title: Sketch Guy: Six Steps to Ditching Your Fear and Starting That Big Thing
media.description: #NA
description: Remind yourself of how electric your idea feels when you are most stoked. Find a quiet place. Write it down (again). Then, get started.
dc.creator: CARL RICHARDS

title: Sketch Guy: Time to Be Honest About the Fear That’s Getting in Your Way
media.description: #NA
description: What is stopping you from springing that big, life-changing project or side hustle on the world? Fear, not edits or fonts or lack of an agent.
dc.creator: CARL RICHARDS

title: Retiring: Declaring War on Financial Abuse of Older People
media.description: Mariana Cooper, 87, was robbed of more than $217,000 by a woman she believed had befriended her.
description: After Amy Lecoq’s grandmother had her life savings stolen by a woman who posed as a friend, she became an advocate for stricter protections for older Americans.
dc.creator: ELIZABETH OLSON

title: Your Money: A Baby or Your Money Back: All About Fertility Clinic Package Deals
media.description: After several miscarriages, the Chamberses took their doctors up on an offer to hand over $50,000 — $20,000 more than what they might have paid for the in vitro fertilization and other services that they needed at the time.
media.credit: Gabriella Demczuk for The New York Times
description: In the high-stakes casino of fertility treatment, some pay large sums upfront for the promise of a baby — or a refund. Doctors tend to pick patients with the best odds of success.
dc.creator: RON LIEBER

title: Wealth Matters: How Top Philanthropists Wield Power Through Their Donations
media.description: David Callahan, the author of “The Givers: Money, Power and Philanthropy in a New Gilded Age,” a book about the private world of high-profile philanthropists who hold great influence in American life and politics.
media.credit: Bryan Thomas for The New York Times
description: A new book by David Callahan, who tracks major charitable donations and their outcomes (good and bad), depicts the outsize power of the very rich.
dc.creator: PAUL SULLIVAN
category.4: The Givers: Wealth, Power, and Philanthropy in a New Gilded Age (Book)

title: Loans ‘Designed to Fail’: States Say Navient Preyed on Students
media.description: Ashley Hardin at home in Seattle in February. Ms. Hardin still owes almost all of the $150,000 she borrowed to attend Brooks Institute of Photography. Now she works as a waitress and pays more to her lender each month than to her landlord.
description: Lawsuits filed by Illinois and Washington against the Sallie Mae spinoff firm say high-risk loans were part of a growth strategy that has left former students buried in debt.
dc.creator: STACY COWLEY and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

title: Sketch Guy: Regrets. You Have a Few. Don’t Beat Yourself Up Over Them.
media.description: #NA
description: A life without regrets is one where you probably haven’t learned anything from the struggle to decide between two things you care about deeply.
dc.creator: CARL RICHARDS

title: Retiring: Hey Hey, My My: Aging Rock Fans Still Hold Their Lighters High
media.description: Joanne Warren, center, and Mark Hover, right, listening to Yonder Mountain String Band on Thursday night at the Belly Up Tavern in Solana Beach, Calif. Now that he is retired, Mr. Hover, 65, says he attends more than 100 concerts a year.
media.credit: Carlos Gonzalez for The New York Times
description: Rock ’n’ roll will never die, at least not as long as a generation that once said it mistrusted anyone over 30 keeps trekking to concerts.

title: Your Money Adviser: Medical Debt: You May Not Owe It
media.description: #NA

title: Your Money Adviser: Flood Insurance: Pricier This Year, and May Go Higher
media.description: #NA
description: Premiums under the government’s flood insurance program just rose, but most people don’t know that homeowner’s insurance policies don’t cover floods.

title: Your Money Adviser: Study Finds Car Insurers Raise Rates in Minority Neighborhoods
media.description: Rush hour traffic in Los Angeles. California was one of four states examined in a new report on insurance rates.

title: The Haggler: When ‘Free’ Really Means Irritation
media.description: #NA

title: Applied Science: Damaging Your Phone, Accidentally on Purpose
media.description: #NA

title: Independence Days: My Perfect Imperfect Gap Year

title: He Saves Fashion Models From Financial Chaos

title: Retiring: Policyholders in Limbo After Rare Failure of Insurer
media.description: Michelle Leonard, a Penn Treaty policyholder in Venus, Fla., said she was shocked to learn of the liquidation.

title: Economic View: Caution Signals Are Blinking for the Trump Bull Market

title: Wealth Matters: Giving Like a Rockefeller, Even if You’re Not Super-Rich
media.description: Michael Quattrone, a grandson of David Rockefeller, in Tarrytown, N.Y., at the Stone Barns Center for Food and Agriculture, which Mr. Rockefeller founded. Mr. Quattrone is chairman of the David Rockefeller Fund, one of the family’s philanthropic vehicles.

description: The family of David Rockefeller has brought flexibility, responsibility and a sense of gratitude to their philanthropy.

title: Basing Life on What You Can Afford
media.description: Avalon Manly, middle school teacher

title: The Subconscious Decision: What’s Worth It

media.credit: Whitney Curtis for The New York Times

title: Sketch Guy: Sometimes, Spending Brings a Bigger Return Than Saving

title: Your Money Adviser: A Tax Penalty for I.R.A. Withdrawals Can Sneak Up on You
media.description: #NA

title: Sketch Guy: How to Turn Your Wishes Into Reality Instead of Regrets
media.description: #NA
description: Find one thing on your wish list, and do it today. The process is simple, and boring, but far from easy.

title: Inside Wealth: Tracking the Yachts and Jets of the Mega-Rich
media.description: The Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev’s jet and yacht were in some places at times when President Trump or members of his family were in the same area, according to tracking data. Investigations of potential ties between the president and Russia have drawn attention to location-tracking sites.
media.credit: Benjamin Bechet for The New York Times
description: New technology and websites are making it easier to spot the whereabouts of people like the Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev.

title: ‘Budget for Everything’: Basing Life on What You Can Afford

title: Special Section: Getting Workers to Save More for Retirement
media.description: At Gilman School, a private school in Baltimore, Sean Furlong used behavioral finance methods to raise retirement plan participation to an average contribution rate of 22 percent, including the company match.

description: Changing how people think about the money they save is one of the central tenets of a movement that is based on behavioral finance.

media.description: In a series of ads for American Family Insurance, pro athletes Kevin Durant, left, and J.J. Watt offer encouragement to different people.

description: Rather than request sheets and china, some engaged couples are asking for contributions to their favorite cause.

title: Your Money Adviser: Ways to Save (and Not Spend) Your Tax Refund

title: Retiring: Single? No Children? No Will? Big Mistake

title: Wealth Matters: A $2,000 Room and Stale Pastry? When Luxury Travel Goes Awry

title: Your Money Adviser: What to Do if You Have Medical Debt

title: Finally, a Retirement Plan for Job-Hopping Millennials

description: The need or urge to offload art collected since the 1970s is both a bonanza and a challenge for institutions like the Minnesota Historical Society.

title: Conversation With: Replacing Work: A New Purpose Can Lift Your Emotional Well-Being
media.description: Dorothy W. Cantor, a psychotherapist from Westfield, N.J., says that the experiences of people in her family who had problems related to their own retirements taught her a great deal.
description: Retirement can lead to boredom and depression, a therapist advises. Ask how you want to spend your time, she says, and remember your childhood dreams.

title: Strategies: The Stock Market Has Gone So High, It’s a Problem
media.description: #NA
description: With the Dow having an exciting bull run, investors are in a quandary: Do I stay or do I go?

title: Your Money Adviser: Should You Move (Your Money) to Canada?

description: Canadian banks say they are not seeing a flood of customers from the south, but the option is available for United States citizens who are nervous.

title: Workers Are Working Longer — and Better
media.description: Bonnie Leonard, 79, retired as dean of continuing education at Wellesley College when she was 65. She now runs her own coaching business, focusing on middle-aged women who are looking to make career and life transitions. She continues to push back her plans to retire.
media.credit: Kayana Szymczak for The New York Times
description: Around 19 percent of Americans 65 and older are still working, a number only expected to go up. Experience and education have a lot to do with it.

media.description: Alana Beard (middle) on the court for the Los Angeles Sparks in 2012. Ms. Beard said the coming season will be her last in the W.N.B.A.

title: In the Middle of a Career, and Finding a New One
media.description: Laura Callens, 52, at home in Rochester. After her husband died, she left a job as a school admissions director and chose to become a nurse. She will soon work in the same hospital unit that treated her husband.
media.credit: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times
description: Job-seekers of a certain age may be daunted by the idea of reinventing themselves. But The Times spoke to a few professionals who did just that, by repurposing their skills and becoming tech-savvy.

title: Money Worries for Retired Women
media.description: Cindy Hounsell, the founder and president of the Women’s Institute for a Secure Retirement. Women often put their own retirement needs last, she says.

description: Less income and time off for families can mean less savings and a greater chance of poverty after age 65.

title: For Many Farmers, Retirement Is a Source of Dread
media.description: Mark and Ellen Francois on their farm in Dundee, Iowa. Mr. Francois, 64, said he was not looking forward to retirement. “I can only play so much golf,” he said.
media.credit: Photographs by Kevin Miyazaki for The New York Times
description: A survey of farmers in Iowa indicates that many do not have a formal retirement plan. The land, they say, is their 401(k).

title: Helping Your Children Plan for Retirement, Even as You Plan for Yours

title: Wealth Matters: The Three Different Flavors of Family Businesses
media.description: Dennis T. Jaffe said his research with James Grubman suggested that President Trump was rooted in the “honor” family business culture, which places a primacy on family loyalties.
media.credit: Brandon Thibodeaux for The New York Times
description: Two psychologists have identified distinguishing cultures — revolving around honor, individualism and obligation — that they say shed light on potential frictions.

title: Your Money: Republicans Want You in a Health Savings Account. So Now What?

title: Inside Wealth: For Millionaire Immigrants, a Global Welcome Mat

title: What to Do Now to Retire Better
media.description: #NA
description: How to get your financial situation in shape, whether you are closing in on retirement or just starting out.

title: Rethinking Retirement for Longer Lives With Fewer Safety Nets
media.description: Kim Moske, shown outside her home in Delaware, Ohio, is 56 and expects to retire in six years. She started to save and invest in her late 20s.
media.credit: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times
description: Traditional pensions have grown scarcer, life expectancies are generally greater and, for workers of all ages, planning is more important than ever.

title: The Anti-Trump Activist Taking On Retailers
media.description: Shannon Coulter, a founder of Grab Your Wallet, a campaign urging a boycott of retailers who carry Trump-family products, in a rented work space in San Francisco.

description: Putting together a list of companies selling Trump products has transformed Shannon Coulter’s life, and not always for the better.

title: Reverie: How Big Do You Want Your Nest Egg to Be?
media.description: Julien Mellon is a tour guide who was raised in Flatbush, Brooklyn. His dream amount of money is $20 million. He would buy a “beautiful” home but have enough left to spend $100,000 a year.

title: Losing a Fortune Often Comes Down to One Thing: Family

title: Who Are the Richest of the Rich?

media.credit: Ed Alcock for The New York Times
description: A look at 10 billionaires’ money reveals one thing the superrich have in common: a large amount of cash and liquid securities.

media.credit: Clockwise from top left: Drew Angerer for The New York Times; Mike Segar/Reuters; David A. Grogan/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images; Jonathan Alcorn/Bloomberg

media.description: John D. Rockefeller, who turned his colossal wealth toward a legacy of enduring philanthropy, on his 84th birthday in 1923.

title: Itineraries: Which ‘Trusted Traveler’ Program Is Right for You?
media.description: The T.S.A. PreCheck line at La Guardia Airport. An alternative, Clear, which also allows passengers expedited security, recently opened at La Guardia.

title: Your Money: The 21 Questions You’re Going to Need to Ask About Investment Fees
media.description: Natalie Dunston of Denver, whose husband, Lynn, once exchanged credits he earned selling annuities for a diamond ring worth about $3,500, which he gave to her. “The fiduciary rule ultimately comes down to the fact that some people are making a lot of money at the expense of other people who have no idea how much their adviser is getting paid,” Mr. Dunston said.
media.credit: Matt Nager for The New York Times

description: You can create a question post for your Facebook timeline that encourages your friends to give their advice, complete with links and maps.

title: Ask The Wirecutter: How a Projector Can Substitute for a Television Set
media.description: The media room in a home in Tampa, Fla.
media.credit: Eve Edelheit for The New York Times
description: While projectors cannot replace TVs in all situations, they could be a space-saving option for the times when only a big image will do.
dc.creator: DAMON DARLIN

title: Tech Tip: Use Your Phone as a Digital Magnifying Glass
media.description: #NA
description: Like other mobile platforms, Apple’s iOS 10 software includes a feature to make reading the fine print easier through your phone.
dc.creator: J. D. BIERSDORFER

title: Tech Tip: Getting Google Cards to Load Again
media.description: #NA
description: Various issues can interfere with the information feed from the Google apps displaying properly on your device, but there are workarounds.
dc.creator: J. D. BIERSDORFER

title: On Pro Basketball: Bring On the Monstars: Another Rout Shows LeBron James Is on Jordan’s Level
media.description: LeBron James blocks Avery Bradley’s lay-up on the way to Cleveland’s 130-86 victory over the Celtics in Boston on Friday in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference Finals.
description: As the Cleveland Cavaliers blow through the N.B.A. playoffs, it’s time to admit that James has reached the same celestial level of a certain “Space Jam” star, an achievement worth celebrating.
dc.creator: HARVEY ARATON

title: ‘This Doesn’t Sound Legal’: Inside Nike’s Oregon Project
media.description: In June 2015, Alberto Salazar watched as Galen Rupp competed in the 10,000-meter run at the USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships in Eugene, Ore.
description: A report by antidoping officials says the coach, Alberto Salazar, violated drug protocols with Dathan Ritzenhein, Mo Farah and other elite runners.
dc.creator: MATT HART

title: N.B.A. Player Enes Kanter Released After Being Held in Romania
media.description: Enes Kanter of the Oklahoma City Thunder said in a video posted on Twitter that the authorities in Romania had detained him and told him his passport had been canceled.
description: Kanter, a Turk, posted a video on Twitter from an airport saying his passport was canceled because he opposes President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, whom he called “the Hitler of our century.”
dc.creator: BENJAMIN HOFFMAN

title: Extra Bases: Texas Rangers, a Perennial Contender, Surge Back
media.description: A happy throng of Rangers awaited Mike Napoli after his game-ending home run against the Padres on May 11. The victory was part of a winning streak that reached 10 games on Friday.
description: The Rangers, who have reached the postseason five times this decade, have recovered from a slow start thanks to a nine-game winning streak.
dc.creator: TYLER KEPNER

title: On Baseball: Mike Trout: Baseball’s Best, Without the Brand
media.description: Mike Trout, playing at Citi Field on Friday night, is everything good about his sport.
media.credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
description: At the age of 25, the Angels’ Trout is among the game’s best. One thing he’s not, though, is anyone’s idea of a swaggering self-promoter.
dc.creator: TYLER KEPNER

title: Terence Crawford’s Greatest Fight May Be With Himself
media.description: Terence Crawford after beating Thomas Dulorme of Puerto Rico in April 2015. Crawford is 30-0 with 21 knockouts.
description: The champion boxer, who wants to be a role model for his children, has continued to struggle with run-ins with the law.
dc.creator: WALLACE MATTHEWS

title: On Horse Racing: Always Dreaming and Classic Empire Size Each Other Up for Round 2 at Preakness
media.description: Classic Empire trained for the Preakness Stakes this week at Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore.
description: The two colts have been spoken of as boxers, and the humans around the more bloodied one, Classic Empire, are itching for a rematch.
dc.creator: JOE DRAPE

title: Preakness 2017 Picks: Experts’ Predictions to Win, Place and Show
media.description: Classic Empire during a training session at Pimlico.
description: Will Always Dreaming complete the second leg of horse racing’s Triple Crown? Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert weigh in on the contenders.
dc.creator: JOE DRAPE and MELISSA HOPPERT

title: W.N.B.A. Is Helping Officials Raise Their Game
media.description: The Sparks’ Nneka Ogwumike in Game 5 of the W.N.B.A. finals. She made a late field goal after officials missed a shot-clock violation, the league said.
description: The league is increasing training for referees after missed calls in last season’s playoffs led to widespread criticism.
dc.creator: SETH BERKMAN

title: Sports Briefing: Venus Williams Falls in the Italian Open Quarterfinals
media.description: Garbiñe Muguruza, the No. 3 seed, serving during her three-set victory over Venus Williams in Rome.
description: Williams lost to Garbiñe Muguruza, the third seed and the defending French Open champion, in three sets.
dc.creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

title: Cavaliers 130, Celtics 86 | Cleveland leads series, 2-0: Cavaliers Build 41-Point Halftime Lead and Crush the Celtics
media.description: Forward Kevin Love dunking in the first half as the Cavaliers built a 41-point halftime lead, setting an N.B.A. playoff record.
media.credit: Winslow Townson/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
description: Isaiah Thomas was lost to a strained right hip for the second half, but the game had already been decided. Cleveland’s halftime lead set an N.B.A. playoff record.
dc.creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

title: Mets 3, Angels 0: Jacob deGrom Goes Seven Innings as Mets Halt a Seven-Game Skid
media.description: Jacob deGrom threw seven scoreless innings to help the Mets end a seven-game losing streak with a 3-0 win over the Angels on Friday night.
description: DeGrom struck out nine as the Mets shut out the Angels at Citi Field. DeGrom became the first Mets pitcher to go more than six innings since he went seven on April 28.
dc.creator: SETH BERKMAN

title: N.B.A. Announces M.V.P. Finalists, and LeBron James Is Not Included
media.description: Russell Westbrook, right, and James Harden during Game 5 of a first-round playoff series on April 25.
media.credit: Thomas Shea/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
description: Russell Westbrook, James Harden and Kawhi Leonard are on the short list for the award.
dc.creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

title: Rays 5, Yankees 4: Joe Girardi Preaches About Family. On Friday, He Practiced It.
media.description: Joe Girardi had been in the Yankees’ dugout for all but three games in his 10-year tenure as manager. On Friday against the Rays, the longtime bench coach Rob Thomson served as manager.
description: Girardi, the Yankees’ manager, missed a game against the Rays to attend the high school graduation of his oldest daughter in South Florida.
dc.creator: BILLY WITZ

title: Mets Seek to Gain Control of a Season in Danger of Slipping Away
media.description: The Mets’ rotation, including, from left, Noah Syndergaard, Jacob deGrom and Matt Harvey, has faced injuries and inconsistency.
media.credit: Noah K. Murray/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
description: Playing 12 of their next 16 games at home, the Mets hope to make up some ground after losing seven in a row.
dc.creator: SETH BERKMAN

title: From Spurs to Warriors, David West Targets First Title With Precision
media.description: Golden State’s David West, right, with Stephen Curry. “He’s a class act,” San Antonio Coach Gregg Popovich said of West.
description: West, a 14-year veteran, played for San Antonio’s Gregg Popovich last year. Now he’s in Golden State’s star-studded lineup, providing assists off the bench.
dc.creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

title: Kevin Durant Is Certain Kawhi Leonard Will Play — ‘100 Percent’
media.description: The Spurs’ Kawhi Leonard grabbing a rebound against the Warriors’ Kevin Durant in Game 1 of the conference finals, in which Leonard aggravated an ankle sprain.
media.credit: Kyle Terada/USA Today Sports, via Reuters
description: The San Antonio Spurs are listing Leonard, their injured star, as “questionable” for Game 3 on Saturday night.
dc.creator: SCOTT CACCIOLA

title: Dominant on Clay, Rafael Nadal Hits a Bump Before the French Open
media.description: Rafael Nadal after a point during his loss to Dominic Thiem in Rome. Nadal is still the heavy favorite in the men’s draw at the French Open.
description: Nadal has reasserted himself as one of the top players in tennis, but he lost in the Italian Open quarterfinals to the up-and-coming Dominic Thiem.
dc.creator: BEN ROTHENBERG

title: How a Golf Course Is Reshaping a New Orleans Neighborhood
media.description: Claudette Ashford and her son, Jonathan, 9, outside their home in Columbia Parc, close to Bayou Oaks. “It’s like having a golf course in your backyard,” she said.
media.credit: Edmund D. Fountain for The New York Times
description: The newly opened South Course at Bayou Oaks and Columbia Parc, a mixed-income development, rose from the ruins of Hurricane Katrina.
dc.creator: ADAM SCHUPAK

title: #NA
media.description: #NA
description: #NA
dc.creator: #NA

title: Extra Bases: Texas Rangers, a Perennial Contender, Surge Back
media.description: A happy throng of Rangers awaited Mike Napoli after his game-ending home run against the Padres on May 11. The victory was part of a winning streak that reached 10 games on Friday.
description: The Rangers, who have reached the postseason five times this decade, have recovered from a slow start thanks to a nine-game winning streak.
dc.creator: TYLER KEPNER
